project.teaser: "SHORE will be focusing on engaging & mobilizing students, teachers, and schools to implement the Mission Ocean objectives to increase ocean literacy with the help of community activities & cooperation projects. SHORE project will last 36 months and cover five different...
project.objective: "SHORE will be focusing on engaging & mobilizing students, teachers, and schools to implement the Mission Ocean objectives to increase ocean literacy with the help of community activities & cooperation projects. SHORE project will last 36 months and cover five different regional areas (Baltic, Black, Mediterranean Sea, Danube & Rhine River Area) with its 14 consortium partners. It will set up Country Hubs to offer guidance for the educators and schools on Blue Curricula, develop and implement their projects and use open schooling methodologies. Contry Hubs will also promote community activities such as exhibitions, workshops, training, seminars, and meetNtalks to increase the awareness of ocean literacy among the society. SHORE will provide grants to 100 schools through three open call periods for proposals to support blue projects for a maximum amount of up to 10.000 euro per grant. Educational materials and trainings for educators will be available during th eprojec to increase their knowledge about sustainable and blue education. A digital platform will be set-up to monitor school projects, and provide a virtual learning environment system including rewards and badges. In addition, at the end of each school period, a public voting session will be held to raise awareness & engagement, create a wider audience and select the best school project which will receive the ""Ocean Ambassador/Literate of the Year Award. An Ocean Literacy Action Center will be established within the YTU to coordinate public activities and bring researchers and public together to enhance ocean literacy during the project and thereafter."
project.title: SHORE: EmpOweR Students as the agents of cHangE
project.keywords: Ocean literacy, education, environmental education, primary and secondary students, European Network of Blue Schools

article.title: A rising tide against ocean illiteracy in Europe

result.title: First public report on the outcome of the open calls
result.description: The report will describe the outcome of the calls (no. submitted projects, evaluation procedure, ranking list of awarded projects, description of each supported project, the date of the award, the duration, the legal name and country, etc..) (T6.3, T6.4).

result.title: SHORE Application package
result.description: The application package (T6.2) will be for schools who are aiming to apply to the open calls for funding. This deliverable will contain, school project submission platform user guide, the call for proposals, a Guide for Applicants, FAQ document about the project submission process, Open Call applicant template, relevant topics and award criteria & scoring of projects, any other Annexes of interest for the successful implementation of the Open Calls.

result.title: Plan for Communication, Dissemination and Outreach (PCDO)
result.description: Plan for Communication, Dissemination and Outreach (PCDO) will be generated (T5.1, T5.2)

result.title: Stakeholder Engagement Report
result.description: The document will include the stakeholder analysis for the communication/dissemination/outreach activities as well as it will report on clustering activities with relevant projects/networks, platforms and Mission Ocean Helix (T5.4).

result.title: A bibliometric analysis of blue growth: Trends, challenges, and opportunities
First Regional Hub report of yearly activity
result.description: The regional hubs report will include the reports from the 5 regional hubs, which will compile the activities undertaken by the country hubs. Those activities include: guidance offered to the schools for the development of blue curricula, including training material, support for the application to the blue school network, community activities to raise the ocean literacy knowledge (T3.1, T3.2, T3.3). There will be 3 reporting periods, one for each open call.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SHORE (SHORE: EmpOweR Students as the agents of cHangE)
result.teaser: During the first 18 months of implementation, the SHORE project made significant progress towards its objectives as outlined in Annex 1 of the Grant Agreement. The consortium successfully launched key infrastructures, developed core educational tools, engaged a wide range of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Exploring Sustainable Strategies for Oceanic Development: A Blue Growth Perspective
Submission and Management Platform
result.description: Task 6.1 will design and set-up a submission & management platform for the successful submission of proposals under the three Open Calls.

result.title: Creation of the digital interaction platform and user guide
result.description: T4.1 will set-up an interaction platform that will be used to track the school projects, voting sessions and interactions among schools & community. D4.4 will include the open-source platform and its user guide.

result.title: Plan for Communication, Dissemination and Outreach (PCDO) V2
result.description: Plan for Communication, Dissemination and Outreach (PCDO) will be improved and updated (T5.1, T5.2)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
